title: Laws Applicable To Andhra Pradesh Continue To Apply To New States Of Telangana & AP After Bifurcation :... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Clarifies Continuity of Laws Post Andhra Pradesh and Telangana Bifurcation

Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court has clarified that the laws applicable to the erstwhile State of Andhra Pradesh will continue to apply to the newly formed States of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh until altered or repealed. This decision follows a legal challenge regarding the jurisdiction of the CBI in corruption cases.

  • The Supreme Court set aside a prior judgment from the Andhra Pradesh High Court regarding consent for CBI investigations in the newly formed states.
  • The High Court previously ruled that CBI needed consent from Andhra Pradesh for investigations under the Prevention of Corruption Act.
  • The Supreme Court found that no explicit consent was necessary as the accused were Central Government employees.
  • The decision references previous case law regarding the continuity of laws after state bifurcations.
  • This ruling may affect similar jurisdictional issues in other cases involving Central Government employees.
“Finally, the Court framed the question: ‘merely because such an employee works within the territory of a particular State, to register an FIR by the CBI in connection with commission of an offence under a Central Act whether consent from the State Government concerned is required or not?’”

The ruling specifies that the continuity of laws remains effective until legally changed, impacting the operations of various governmental agencies in both states.
newTitle: Supreme Court Clarifies Continuity of Laws Post Andhra Pradesh and Telangana Bifurcation

title: Dera Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Gets Top Court Notice In 2002 Murder Case - NDTV
summary:
Supreme Court Issues Notice to Dera Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim in 2002 Murder Case

Date: Today, Source: New Delhi

The Supreme Court has issued a notice to Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh, chief of Dera Sacha Sauda, along with four others in the 2002 murder case of former Dera manager Ranjit Singh, after the CBI challenged the Punjab and Haryana High Court's acquittal.

  • The notice follows the CBI's plea against the acquittal of Ram Rahim and co-accused.
  • The murder occurred on July 10, 2002, related to an anonymous letter alleging sexual exploitation by Ram Rahim.
  • A special CBI court had previously convicted Ram Rahim and four others in 2021, awarding them life imprisonment.
  • In May 2024, the Punjab and Haryana High Court overturned this conviction.
  • Ram Rahim's past convictions include the rape of two women, leading to widespread violence in 2017.
“The CBI court concluded that Ram Rahim orchestrated the murder due to suspicions about Mr. Singh’s involvement in exposing allegations.”

This case highlights the ongoing legal battles involving Gurmeet Ram Rahim and the significant societal implications stemming from his actions.
newTitle: Supreme Court Issues Notice to Dera Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim in 2002 Murder Case

ED conducts searches at DMK MP Kathir Anand’s house in Vellore - The Hindu
summary:
ED Conducts Searches at DMK MP Kathir Anand’s House in Vellore

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted searches at multiple locations in Vellore, including the residence of DMK MP D.M. Kathir Anand, as part of an investigation related to alleged cash-for-votes during the 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

  • ED conducted searches at Kathir Anand's residence and several other places, including an engineering college.
  • Raids began around 7:30 a.m. targeting Anand and his father, Water Resources Minister Duraimurugan.
  • Searches were also conducted at another house of Anand and properties linked to DMK functionary Pooncholai Srinivasan.
  • Previous investigations by Income Tax officials in 2019 led to the seizure of ₹10.48 crore, allegedly meant for voter distribution.
“I know only as many details as you all know. The details of which department the officials [conducting the search] belong to are not clear,” - Duraimurugan

The searches underscore ongoing investigations related to electoral malpractice and aim to unveil deeper connections and financial irregularities.
newTitle: ED Searches DMK MP Kathir Anand's House in Vellore

title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launches infrastructure projects in New Delhi on January 3, 2025 including World Trade Centre - The Hindu
summary:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi launches infrastructure projects in New Delhi on January 3, 2025 including World Trade Centre

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated several development projects in New Delhi, including the World Trade Centre and 1,675 flats for residents of JJ clusters.

  • The PM handed over keys to beneficiaries at Swabhiman Apartments in Ashok Vihar.
  • Eligible beneficiaries pay less than 7% of the total construction cost for the flats.
  • The development initiatives aim to enhance the 'Ease of Living' for Delhi residents.
  • Projects include a new academic block in East Delhi and a foundation for Veer Savarkar College in Najafgarh.
  • The World Trade Centre will provide around 34 lakh square feet of premium commercial space.
“Today is an important day for Delhi's development. At a programme in Ashok Vihar, will be inaugurating and laying the foundation stones for a wide range of development works which will boost 'Ease of Living' for the people of Delhi.” — Narendra Modi

The initiatives are part of a broader development push by the BJP-led central government ahead of the upcoming Assembly elections in Delhi.
newTitle: Narendra Modi Launches Key Infrastructure Projects in New Delhi

title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launches infrastructure projects in New Delhi on January 3, 2025. - The Hindu
summary:
Prime Minister Modi Inaugurates Key Infrastructure Projects in New Delhi

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: ANI

Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched several infrastructure initiatives aimed at improving housing and education in New Delhi today, reflecting the government's commitment to empowering future generations.

  • The Prime Minister inaugurated 1,675 flats for slum dwellers, emphasizing the need for proper housing.
  • Projects include new academic blocks at the Eastern and Western Campuses in East Delhi and Dwarka, respectively.
  • The inauguration is part of a broader effort to boost 'Ease of Living' for Delhi residents.
  • Amid rising political tensions with upcoming assembly polls, the BJP aims to strengthen its position in Delhi.
“These endeavours reflect our unwavering commitment to nurturing future generations by empowering them with knowledge, innovation and opportunities.” — Narendra Modi

The launch of these projects indicates a significant push towards improving infrastructure and educational facilities in Delhi, essential for future development.
newTitle: Prime Minister Modi Inaugurates Key Infrastructure Projects in New Delhi

title: ED raids senior DMK leader and Minister Duraimurugan, MP son in Vellore - DTNEXT
Dense fog in north India: Flights, trains affected amid zero visibility; Delhi airport issues advisory | Details - Hindustan Times
summary:
Dense Fog in North India: Flights, Trains Affected Amid Zero Visibility

Date: Jan 03, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The harsh winter chill has significantly affected north India, with dense fog causing flights and trains to be delayed in Delhi. Visibility levels at the city's airports dropped to extreme lows, leading to travel disruptions.

  • Visibility dropped to zero at Delhi's Palam Airport; Safdarjung Airport reported visibility of just 50 metres.
  • Flights by airlines such as SpiceJet, IndiGo, and Air India experienced delays ranging from 5 to 11 minutes.
  • Over two dozen trains from Delhi faced delays due to poor visibility, affecting travel across the region.
  • The cold wave has impacted several northern states with temperatures plummeting, such as Srinagar recording -1.3°C.
  • Nights shelters in Delhi are providing much-needed relief for the homeless amidst harsh weather conditions.
“Any inconvenience caused is deeply regretted,” stated the airport authorities.

The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecasted dense fog to persist until January 8, with a possibility of light rain providing some relief.
newTitle: Dense Fog Disrupts Travel in North India: Flights and Trains Delayed

title: Delhi Air Travellers Stuck As Dense Fog Hits Flight Ops; Cold Wave Grips North India - News18
summary:
Delhi Air Travellers Stuck As Dense Fog Hits Flight Ops; Cold Wave Grips North India

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

Dense fog in Delhi has caused significant flight delays and disruptions at the airport, as a cold wave grips the region.

  • Dense fog led to advisories from Delhi Airport regarding possible flight operations delays.
  • Passengers are advised to contact airlines for updates on their flights.
  • The India Meteorological Department forecasts a persistent cold wave in Delhi over the next few days.
  • Trains in and out of Delhi are also facing delays due to the fog.
  • Schools in Noida are closed for classes up to grade 8 due to the weather conditions.
“Due to bad weather in Delhi (DEL), all departures/arrivals and their consequential flights might get affected.” – SpiceJet

This extreme weather is affecting travel across the region and highlights the impact of cold waves during winter months.
newTitle: Delhi Air Travellers Stuck As Dense Fog Hits Flight Ops; Cold Wave Grips North India

Flight ops hit as dense fog covers Delhi, parts of North India - The Indian Express
summary:
Delhi Weather Today: Flight operations hit as dense fog covers national capital, parts of North India

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Thick fog enveloped Delhi this morning as the national capital continues to face a cold wave along with a warning from the Delhi airport regarding potential flight delays due to low visibility.

  • Dense fog conditions are expected to persist along with cold wave alerts across Delhi.
  • The air quality index in Delhi recorded at 223, classified as 'very poor'.
  • Delhi International Airport issued a notice for passengers to contact airlines due to potential delays.
  • The weather forecast predicts light to moderate rainfall early next week.
“Delhi: Dense fog engulfs the national capital as cold wave grips the city.”

Conditions are likely to affect daily activities and flight schedules in the coming days.
newTitle: Delhi Weather Today: Flight operations hit as dense fog covers national capital, parts of North India

title: ‘I want dictatorship of Blinkit’: People praise company’s ‘ambulance in 10 minutes' service - Hindustan Times
summary:
Public Enthusiasm for Blinkit's New 'Ambulance in 10 Minutes' Service

Jan 03, 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

Blinkit has launched a revolutionary 'ambulance in 10 minutes' service in parts of Gurgaon, drawing significant attention and mixed reactions on social media.

  • The new service features five ambulances to begin with, as stated by CEO Albinder Dhindsa.
  • Social media reactions have varied, with many praising the initiative as necessary and life-saving.
  • Some users have expressed concerns, labeling the service as “dystopian” and not widely available.
“We will operate this service at an affordable cost for customers and invest in really solving this critical problem for the long term.” - Albinder Dhindsa

Blinkit's service aims to tackle quick and reliable access to ambulances, potentially expanding into more cities in the future, based on its early success.
newTitle: Public Enthusiasm for Blinkit's New 'Ambulance in 10 Minutes' Service

Delhi Police issues traffic advisory ahead of PM Narendra Modi's events today | Check restrictions - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi Police Issues Traffic Advisory Ahead of PM Modi's Events

Date: January 3, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi Traffic Police has issued an advisory for January 3 as Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate key infrastructure projects in Delhi.

  • PM Modi will inaugurate and lay foundation stones for seven projects.
  • He will visit newly constructed flats under the In-Situ Slum Rehabilitation Project.
  • Traffic restrictions will be enforced on specific routes to manage VVIP traffic.

Traffic Restrictions on These Routes

  1. Mall Road (Ring Road): Hakikat Nagar Red Light to Azadpur Chowk (both sides).
  2. GTK Road: Azadpur Chowk to Gurudwara Nanak Pio.
  3. Bhamashah Marg: Model Town-1 to Nanak Pio.
  4. Lala Achhintam Marg & Brahma Kumari Marg: Gujranwala & Derawal areas.
  5. Nahar Singh Marg: Prembari Chowk to Inderlok Metro Station (both sides).
  6. Gulab Singh Marg: Satyawati College to Prerna Chowk.
  7. Swami Narayan Marg: Delhi Jal board Red Light to Laxmi Bai College.
  8. Mahatma Gandhi Marg: Britannia Chowk to Azadpur.

Date and Time of Restrictions

Traffic restrictions will be in effect from 9am to 4pm on January 3. Residents are advised to plan their journeys accordingly.

“Motorists are encouraged to stay updated on traffic conditions through the Delhi Traffic Police's official channels.”

This advisory emphasizes the importance of following traffic rules during the VVIP movements to ensure smooth flow and public convenience.
newTitle: Delhi Police Issues Traffic Advisory Ahead of PM Modi's Events

title: The Hindu Morning Digest, January 3, 2024 - The Hindu
summary:
The Hindu Morning Digest, January 3, 2024

Published: January 03, 2025 06:31 AM IST

Source: The Hindu

The article covers significant updates including remarks by Union Home Minister Amit Shah regarding Article 370, sports news about Rohit Sharma, education infrastructure issues in India, and comments on recent political resolutions by Prime Minister Modi.

  • Amit Shah claims Article 370 fueled terrorism in Kashmir.
  • Rohit Sharma to rest for the Sydney Test following uncertainty about his participation.
  • Government report reveals over 1.5 lakh Indian schools lack functional electricity.
  • Congress president Kharge criticizes PM Modi's new year resolutions.
  • EPFO 3.0 system to be launched by June 2025.
  • Madhya Pradesh CM assures that incineration of Union Carbide waste will not harm the environment.
  • Army issues a request for anti-drone ammunition amid increasing drone threats.
  • CISF reports a 40% drop in death rates among its personnel.
  • Nitish Kumar's response to Lalu's offer to join the INDIA bloc remains ambiguous.
  • Supreme Court urges Delhi government to resolve disputes regarding the Farishtey scheme.
  • BJP leader Vijay Goel calls for a ban on real money gaming platforms.
  • FBI confirms New Orleans truck attack was an act of terrorism carried out by a lone actor.
  • Palestinian Authority suspends Al Jazeera broadcasts, citing incitement.
“People are being financially ruined,” said BJP leader Vijay Goel regarding online gaming platforms.

title: 'Go Goa' Gone? Here's What A Trip Around Christmas Revealed About The Tourism Scenario - News18
summary:
Go Goa Gone? Insights from a Christmas Trip to Goa

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

The article discusses the current tourism scenario in Goa during the holiday season, contrasting social media perceptions of empty beaches with the author's personal experience of crowds and activity.

  • Social media often depicts Goa’s beaches and markets as empty during Christmas, yet the author's experience shows it to be crowded.
  • Visits to popular beaches revealed high occupancy, particularly after Christmas.
  • North Goa was reported to be very crowded, leading the author to prefer South Goa.
  • Restaurants and markets saw increased crowds as Christmas approached.
  • Local authorities need to address issues discouraging tourism, such as higher costs and vehicle rental challenges.
“Certainly, cheaper global destinations have gained some popularity over Goa.”

In conclusion, despite some challenges faced by the tourism industry, Goa remains a popular destination during the holiday season, with varying experiences reported by visitors.
newTitle: Go Goa Gone? Insights from a Christmas Trip to Goa

title: As Goa’s image takes a hit, tourism minister’s tirade against ‘paid influencers’: Seek ‘free lunch and stay’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Goa Tourism Minister Criticizes Influencers for Defaming State

Publication Date: Thursday, Source: Indian Express

The Goa Tourism Minister has condemned social media influencers for spreading false claims about a decline in tourist footfall, asserting that Goa's tourism is thriving and expecting further growth in the coming years.

  • Minister Rohan Khaunte accused certain influencers of being paid to harm Goa's image.
  • He highlighted exceptional hotel occupancy rates, claiming close to 100% for higher-end hotels.
  • Khaunte plans to expose influencers trying to malign Goa's reputation.
  • He addressed some operational issues affecting tourism but emphasized the necessity of promoting positive narratives.
“It’s a direct charge I am making. These influencers are paid influencers onboarded by people to malign Goa.” - Rohan Khaunte

The minister called on local influencers to promote the true essence of Goa and shared plans to enhance the state's tourist experience, particularly emphasizing local culture and hospitality.
newTitle: Goa Tourism Minister Criticizes Influencers for Defaming State

BJP's Savvy Move On Savarkar Ratchets Up Hindutva Rhetoric In Delhi Polls - News18
summary:
BJP's Strategic Move on Savarkar Boosts Hindutva Messaging Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: January 03, 2025

Source: News18

The BJP is making a significant move by initiating the work on a college named after Veer Savarkar, coinciding with the upcoming Delhi elections, in a bid to solidify its Hindutva appeal.

  • The foundation for the college named after Savarkar is being laid by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • This action is seen as a strategy to secure the Hindu voter base just before the Delhi elections.
  • Previous proposals for naming the college included other notable figures, but Savarkar's name has been prioritized.
  • The Delhi elections are expected to be competitive with multiple parties contesting for votes.
  • BJP leaders believe that recent scandals involving AAP strengthen their political position.
“Arvind Kejriwal is worried about his party’s chances in Delhi this time,” a senior BJP leader commented.

The BJP's efforts reflect its commitment to consolidate Hindu votes through strategic messaging as it approaches the elections, while also preparing for significant competition from opponents.
newTitle: BJP's Strategic Move on Savarkar Boosts Hindutva Messaging Ahead of Delhi Elections

title: Foreign hiker detained at Delhi airport for carrying banned GPS device - Hindustan Times
summary:
Foreign hiker detained at Delhi airport for carrying banned GPS device

Date: Jan 03, 2025

Source: HT News Desk

A Scottish hiker, Heather, claimed that she was detained at Delhi airport for allegedly carrying a banned Garmin Inreach GPS device. She reported that security personnel informed her of the ban upon her passing through security.

  • Heather was detained on January 3, 2025, at Delhi airport for carrying a Garmin Inreach device.
  • She was informed that the device is banned in India and was subsequently handed over to police.
  • Heather recorded her experience in a video posted on Instagram.
  • Despite contacting her embassy, they could not intervene as she was under police custody.
  • After questioning, she was allowed to leave but must return for a court appearance.
  • A similar incident occurred with a Czech national in Goa for possessing a different banned GPS device.
“At 9pm, I was finally released from the police station, but I am required to return to attend court,” Heather stated.

This incident highlights ongoing issues regarding the carrying of specific technological devices into India and the need for awareness among travelers about local regulations.
newTitle: Foreign hiker detained at Delhi airport for carrying banned GPS device

title: Navy skydivers collide during rehearsal for operational demo - The Hindu
summary:
Navy Skydivers Collision During Rehearsal for Operational Demo

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

During rehearsal for an operational demonstration, two Navy skydivers collided mid-air and fell into the sea, fortunately sustaining no injuries.

  • The incident occurred at RK Beach in Visakhapatnam on January 2, 2025, around 5:40 PM.
  • Both skydivers were quickly rescued by the Navy’s emergency team.
  • The collision happened during their glide towards the main stage of the event.
  • Witnesses expressed concern over the windy conditions which may have contributed to the accident.
“We were shocked to see two Navy skydivers colliding and falling during the rehearsal. Fortunately, they fell into the sea...” – K. Rohit, spectator

This event highlights the risks involved in aerial demonstrations, but thankfully, the quick response prevented potential injuries.
newTitle: Navy Skydivers Collision During Rehearsal in Visakhapatnam

title: Toxic waste from India's 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy site moved for disposal after 40 years - Reuters India
On road to Maha Kumbh, the 84 ‘pillars of faith’: ‘It’s a symbolic way to attain moksha’ - The Indian Express
summary:
On road to Maha Kumbh, the 84 ‘pillars of faith’: ‘It’s a symbolic way to attain moksha’

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Indian Express

With 10 days left for the Maha Kumbh, the Uttar Pradesh government is installing 84 red sandstone pillars known as “Aastha Ke Sthambh (pillars of faith)” along the road to the airport in Prayagraj.

  • The installation will cost Rs 17 crore, each pillar costing around Rs 20 lakh.
  • Each pillar features 108 names of Lord Shiva and is topped with a kalash (pitcher).
  • The 84 pillars symbolize a journey through 84 lakh yonis, reflecting the teachings of Sanatan Dharma philosophy.
  • An estimated 40 to 45 crore devotees are expected to visit during the Maha Kumbh from January 13 to February 26.
“Life is a huge journey going through the infinite cycles of birth and death, the soul changes its form 84 lakh times in an attempt to find itself.” - Acharya Mithlesh Nandani Sharan

This initiative aims to enhance the experience of devotees by connecting them with the philosophical significance of the Maha Kumbh.
newTitle: On road to Maha Kumbh, the 84 ‘pillars of faith’: ‘It’s a symbolic way to attain moksha’

title: More Jobs Created, Better Macro Growth Recorded During PM Modi's Tenure Vs UPA Regime: RBI Data - News18
Lalu Prasad's 'Doors Open for Nitish' Fuels Speculation, Bihar CM Reacts - News18
'All Of Us Should Be Ashamed': Madras HC Says Anna University Sexual Assault Case Being Politicised - News18
summary:
Madras HC Condemns Politicization of Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: News18

In a recent statement, the Madras High Court expressed its dismay over the Anna University sexual assault case, indicating that the issue is being politicized rather than being addressed with genuine concern.

  • The Madras High Court criticized the police for mishandling the case and allowing politically motivated protests.
  • Justice P. Velmurugan expressed that the case should serve as a wake-up call about societal issues.
  • The incident involves the sexual assault of a 19-year-old engineering student on December 23, which has garnered significant media attention.
  • The court formed an all-women Special Investigation Team to investigate the case.
  • Interim compensation of ₹25 lakhs has been ordered for the survivor.
“All of us should be ashamed. Strictly speaking, we all are co-accused in such crimes.” - Justice P. Velmurugan

The court's remarks emphasize the need for serious societal reflection on attitudes towards gender and caste discrimination and the responsibilities of media and political entities in addressing such grave issues.
newTitle: Madras HC Condemns Politicization of Anna University Sexual Assault Case
